description: The Unification Church, founded in 1954 by Sun Myung Moon (Reverend Moon), is a Korean new religious movement blending Christian eschatology, Eastern philosophy, and anti-communism. It teaches that Moon and his wife Hak Ja Han are the True Parents fulfilling Jesus' mission, with salvation through the Blessing Ceremony (mass weddings), tithing, and the Divine Principle scripture. Emphasizing family restoration, global peace, and economic self-sufficiency via businesses, it promotes moral purity and interfaith unity against 'Satanic' influences.

description: Marxism, developed by Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels in the 19th century, is a socio-economic and philosophical framework positing historical materialism: class struggle as the engine of history, leading from capitalism's contradictions to proletarian revolution and a classless communist society. It emphasizes dialectical analysis, labor theory of value, and critiques of alienation, religion as 'opium of the people,' with no supernatural elements—purely empirical and predictive via economic laws.
